factText: Here's a look from Rutherford County this morning, where flooding has closed schools and prompted water rescues overnight. FLOODING/ HIGH WATER ALERT Stay away from these areas if at all possible!. Water rescues, road and school closures reported throughout Rutherford County due to flooding https://t.co/icy9ULRtXI. The Town of Forest City has declared a State of Emergency due to flash flooding.

A flood watch remains in effect for most of Middle Tennessee until noon today, but at least the threat of severe storms is diminished. There are still several flood advisories in effect, and the flood watch for the eastern half of the mid-state(including Nashville) is out until noon. The City of Pineville and Bell County officials will continue to keep the public updated should things change to a mandatory evacuation and/or other gate closures are issued.
informationNeeds: CrisisFACTS-011_general_Are evacuation orders still in place or have they been lifted?

factText: There are numerous reports of flooding all across the area. * At 554 AM EST, local law enforcement reported heavy rain that has cause flooding and the closing of several highways. Heavy rains that continue to flood the area roadways have caused very dangerous driving conditions. Rain Gauges are indicating minor flooding is occurring to our west. Heavy rainfall throughout the day today has resulted in localized flooding, closed roads, and hazardous travel conditions across our area.

Anyone needing a shelter the American Red Cross has opened a Shelter at 2nd Baptist Church Rutherfordton #fFlood #1Town1Team Flood Update 12:45 pm : Even though the water is starting to subside in some places we are still under a flash flood warning until 4:15pm.

We are also experiencing hazardous road conditions, including several closed roads, due to significant flooding. We still have several roads in the county that are impassable because of flooding and there has also been a winter weather advisory issued for the overnight hours. Many roads are closed. These roads are flooding!. Be careful as some roads are still impassable.

Flood Warning issued February 06 at 9:44AM CST until February 07 at 2:40PM CST by NWS .. Flash flood warning issued for Rutherford County until 9:30 p.m. https://t.co/gK3KiLdDk6. ..COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 8 AM TO 11 AM EST FRIDAY.. A Flood Warning was issued for the Cumberland River in Pineville until Friday morning.

Flooding will affect areas along the Harpeth River from Franklin to Bellevue. Major flooding is likely along the Cumberland River at Barbourville and Williamsburg over the next few days. Friday through Wednesday: Several more waves of heavy rainfall are likely from Monday through Friday of next week, which could lead to additional significant flooding across the area. Flash flooding is likely given the increasingly saturated soil conditions.

The Pigeon Forge Community Center, 170 Community Center Dr., is a shelter for those who have been affected. The Salvation Army of Greenville County, SC at 417 Rutherford Street and Miracle Hill Ministries at 575 W. Washington Street Greenville Rescue Mission are opening additional emergency shelter beds for men due to the inclement weather, heavy rain and flooding. At that time we will issue a VOLUNTARY evacuation for residents in the Wallsend community.
informationNeeds: CrisisFACTS-011_general_Where can displaced people find emergency housing?

factText: If you live in a flood prone area, monitor conditions and be ready to move to a safe area if needed.

Bell County declared a state of emergency Thursday morning. State of Emergency The Town of Rutherfordton has declared a State Of Emergency due to flash flooding. The list keeps going.. now Polk and Rutherford counties under the FLASH FLOOD WARNING until 1:15pm. Polk and Rutherford counties under Flash Flood Warnings until 1:15pm!. Rutherford County is now under a FLASH FLOOD WARNING until 10:15 p.m. tonight.

Murfreesboro and other parts of Rutherford could see additional flooding https://t.co/Xe09xJiZqY. Here's an updated list of flooded areas in Rutherford County (as of about 10 mins ago, from the Sheriff's Office) https://murfreesboro.com/rutherford-county-flooding-update/. Parts of Rutherford, Polk, Swain, Graham, and Macon remain under a Flood Warning Thursday evening. Parts of Rutherford County are very flooded from overnight.
informationNeeds: CrisisFACTS-011_Flood_Which areas are most affected by flooding during {event}?

factText: The water department points out that people with compromised immune systems, infants and some elderly may be at an increased risk.
As a precaution, residents are being asked to boil their water before consumption.
Woodbury Water Department reports the town's water treatment plant has experienced some flooding, leading to the possibility of contamination to the plant's treated water.

UPDATE (4:15PM): The National Weather Service has extended the flash flood warning for Rutherford County until 10:15PM. Rutherford County flooding�update https://t.co/v0GrJX0Set https://t.co/FQtF33k6so
informationNeeds: CrisisFACTS-011_general_What news outlets are reporting on {event} and what are they saying?

factText: The Sheriff’s Office received complaints part of the road surface is breaking apart on River Eagleville Road and Shoemaker Road. Some roads are still not passable and many roads are barley passable tonight with large debris with streets and roads including, but not limited to; Doolittle Rd, Sunny Slope Rd, Locks Creek Rd, Hurricane Creek Rd, Sycamore Creek rd, Big Hill Rd, Wilmouth Creek Rd, Gassaway Main St, Auburntown Rd, McBroom St and several other city streets, just to name a few.

Cumberland county is also under a Flash Flood Watch until 8:30pm. CHEROKEE COUNTY IS CURRENTLY UNDER A FLASH FLOOD WARNING, TORNADO WATCH AND SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING THE NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE IN PEACHTREE CITY HAS ISSUED. Flash flood watch in most if SE VA including Williamsburg, Surry, Richmond, Hampton Roads, Isle of Wight, etc. Our area is under a Flash Flood Watch issued by the National Weather Service until 4:00 PM Friday.
CUMBERLAND COUNTY RESCUE SQUAD HELPS MAN TRAPPED IN CAMPER BY FLOOD https://t.co/irAQtTxViM

A shelter has opened for residents of Rutherford County displaced by storms and flooding. Our Rutherfordton Fire & Rescue swift water teams are still actively working to evacuate and rescue people along the rivers in our area. Three people and a dog rescued tonight from a flooded home in Rutherford County. Flood waters trapped people inside their Rutherford County home during severe weather Wednesday night.
informationNeeds: CrisisFACTS-011_Flood_Are there ongoing rescue operations for people trapped in floodwaters?

factText: Deputies answer 14 water rescue calls Sheriff’s deputies rescued motorists who were trapped in rising flood waters since Wednesday night in Rutherford County. ⚠️ Rutherford County remains under a Flash Flood Warning until 10:15pm, Thursday, 02/06/2020. The Sheriff’s Office asks drivers to obey the barricades, caution tape and signs to prevent driving into the dangerous water. https://t.co/5DJSEeGwh1 Flash Flood Warning for Rutherford and Wilson County until 11:30pm CST Wednesday.

factText: For emergency assistance in floods and storms call 132 500.

factText: WEATHER ALERT 💧⚠️ Flash Flood Warning continues — Effective until 6:45am Friday morning —Avoid flooded areas and be alert for road ponding — For the following surrounding counties: Cumberland, Hoke, Harnett, Sampson, Moore. A lot of flash flood warnings issued for the area highlighted in the green, a tornado warning for Catawba & Lincoln counties until 11AM, & a tornado watch for Catawba, Cleveland, Gaston, Lincoln, Polk, & Rutherford counties until 5PM.

Emergency Preparedness Update: As the rains continue, the Town of Lake Lure, NC is using precautions not to release more water than is received from the ongoing storm event. Flash flood warnings, state of emergency declared... WHILE WE REMAIN UNDER A FLOOD WARNING, STAY ALERT FOR RAPIDLY CHANGING CONDITIONS. ADDITIONAL RAINFALL AMOUNTS OF ONE TO THREE ARE POSSIBLE IN THE WARNED AREA.
